meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a keloid.
meanings.sent1: Her keloidal scar was raised and shiny.
meanings.sent2: The keloidal tissue on his arm was thick and dark.
meanings.sent3: The keloidal patch on the teddy bear looked like a tiny mountain.
meanings.sent4: The keloidal clouds in the sky seemed to be sculpted by an artist.
meanings.sent5: The keloidal texture of the rock made it stand out among the smooth stones.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the formation of keloids.
meanings.sent1: The keloidal skin showed signs of scarring.
meanings.sent2: Her keloidal condition made her self-conscious about her appearance.
meanings.sent3: The keloidal growth on the tree trunk was a surprise to the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The keloidal landscape of the desert was a reminder of harsh conditions.
meanings.sent5: The keloidal nature of the wound indicated a slow healing process.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a keloid.
meanings.sent1: The keloidal texture of the fabric felt rough against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The keloidal appearance of the scar made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent3: The keloidal shape of the cloud resembled a fluffy pillow.
meanings.sent4: The keloidal pattern on the leaf looked like intricate lacework.
meanings.sent5: The keloidal color of the flower petals was vibrant and eye-catching.
